perturbation.original_text: 2. Payment Terms. Upon the signing of this Agreement, Client agrees to pay to Company a total of $5,000. Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Payment Terms. Upon the signing of this Agreement, Client agrees to pay to Company a total of $5,000. Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 within 15 days of the completion of Stage 1 of the Scope of Work.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in payment terms. The original text states the remaining $3,100 is due 'on completion of the Scope of Work', implying the entire project. The modified text states the remaining $3,100 is due 'within 15 days of the completion of Stage 1 of the Scope of Work'. This creates ambiguity as to when the final payment is due, potentially leading to disputes. The text doesn't define when the "completion" happens, Stage 1, all stages, therefore makes an uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018.
perturbation.changed_text: Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. The Company guarantees that the project will be completed no later than June 15, 2018.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction related to project completion dates. The original text sets a defined project timeline ending on May 3, 2018. The added sentence guarantees completion by June 15, 2018. This directly contradicts the initially established project timeline, creating confusion and uncertainty about the actual deadline for project completion. This could result in legal disputes if the project finishes after May 3, 2018, but before June 15, 2018.

perturbation.original_text: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client’s failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the standard hourly rate of $40 plus twenty-five percent (25%).
perturbation.changed_text: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client’s failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work will be determined on a case-by-case basis at the discretion of the Company, but will never exceed the standard hourly rate of $40.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the surcharge calculation for rush work. The original text states that the surcharge is the standard hourly rate of $40 plus twenty-five percent (25%). The modified text states that the surcharge is determined on a case-by-case basis at the discretion of the company, but will never exceed $40. This contradicts the original agreement on how the surcharge is calculated, creating ambiguity and uncertainty. The original clause established a clear calculation, while the altered text gives company discretionary control and an upper limit, opening possibilities for dispute.
